result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert A. Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: concurrent to Ct. 2 and consecutive to any other sentence

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Submit to HIV and/or STD testing with results being provided to District Attorney.

records.addlTxt:
9:37 am - Defendant Robert A. Lopez in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA states agreement. Victim's mother is given permission to record proceeding.  DE pleads NO CONTEST to charges.   Court questions DE regarding the plea, plea questionnaire and elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Cts. 1 & 2.  Comments by victim's mother.  Comments by DE. Appeal rights given. Adj. 10:04 am. 
Court imposes:
Ct. 1 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation, cc to Ct. 2 and cs to any other sentence. Conditions: $243 court costs; $200 DNAAS; 2 1/2 month jail term, cs; Submit to HIV and/or STD testing with results being provided to District Attorney
Ct. 2 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation, cc to Ct. 1 and cs to any other sentence. Conditions: $243 court costs
Motion and order for release of defendant's medical records
Plea and sentencing on 06-17-15 at 9:30 am

ADDRESS INFO for Robert A. Lopez
Current: 1501 Albert Street, Racine Youthful Offender Correctional Facility, Racine, WI 53404 United States  (Effective: 04-07-2015)
Prior: Dodge Correctional Institution #552494, PO Box 700, Waupun, WI 53963 United States
for defendant to submit to HIV and STD tests

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney. NO CONTACT w/D.K.R., DOB 04-06-98 and comply with HIV and STD testing.

11:40 am - Defendant Robert A. Lopez in court via video from Racine Youthful Offender's Correctional Facility with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  DA moves to order that DE undergo HIV and STD testing and to set $2500 signature bond with NO CONTACT w/D.K.R., DOB 04-06-98 and comply with HIV and STD testing.  Comments and questions by defendant.  Adj. 11:45 am.
